parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Properly, feminine of Ludios; Lydia, a Christian woman: -Lydia.
A female seller of purple cloth. Feminine of a compound of porphura and poleo; a female trader in purple cloth.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Thyatira, a place in Asia Minor.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To reverence, worship, adore. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to revere, i.e. Adore.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To open fully. From dia and anoigo; to open thoroughly, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
